questions.question: What is the primary function of Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Microsoft Word is primarily used for creating documents such as letters, reports, and essays.

questions.question: Which tab in Microsoft Word contains options for formatting text?
questions.feedback: The 'Home' tab contains options for text formatting, such as font size, style, and color.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to create a new document in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + N is the shortcut key to create a new blank document in Microsoft Word.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Find and Replace' feature in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: The 'Find and Replace' feature helps you quickly locate specific text and replace it with new content.

questions.question: Which file format is commonly used to save Microsoft Word documents?
questions.feedback: The .docx format is the standard file format for saving Microsoft Word documents.

questions.question: How do you insert a page number in Microsoft Word?
options: Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'Page Number'
Click on the 'Home' tab and select 'Page Layout'
Right-click on the page and select 'Add Page Number'
questions.correct: Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'Page Number'
questions.feedback: To insert page numbers, go to the 'Insert' tab and choose the 'Page Number' option.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Review' tab in Microsoft Word?
options: To add comments and track changes
questions.correct: To add comments and track changes
questions.feedback: The 'Review' tab is used for editing and collaborating on documents, including adding comments and tracking changes.

questions.question: Which feature in Microsoft Word allows you to create a table of contents?
questions.feedback: The 'References' tab contains the option to create a table of contents for your document.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to undo an action in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + Z is the shortcut key to undo the last action in Microsoft Word.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Spelling & Grammar' feature in Microsoft Word?
options: To check the formatting of the document
To identify spelling and grammar errors
questions.correct: To identify spelling and grammar errors
questions.feedback: The 'Spelling & Grammar' feature helps ensure your document is free from spelling and grammatical errors.

questions.question: Which tab in Microsoft Word allows you to change the page orientation?
questions.feedback: The 'Layout' tab allows you to change the page orientation between portrait and landscape.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to save a document in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + S is the shortcut key to save the current document in Microsoft Word.

questions.question: Which feature in Microsoft Word allows you to create a mail merge?
questions.feedback: The 'Mailings' tab contains the options to create a mail merge for sending bulk letters or emails.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Track Changes' feature in Microsoft Word?
options: To track edits made to the document
questions.correct: To track edits made to the document
questions.feedback: The 'Track Changes' feature allows you to see the edits made to the document by different users.

questions.question: Which tab in Microsoft Word contains options for inserting tables, pictures, and shapes?
questions.feedback: The 'Insert' tab contains options for adding tables, pictures, shapes, and other elements to your document.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to print a document in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + P is the shortcut key to open the print dialog box in Microsoft Word.

questions.question: Which feature in Microsoft Word allows you to create a bibliography?
questions.feedback: The 'References' tab contains the options to create a bibliography and manage citations.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Header & Footer' feature in Microsoft Word?
options: To add text at the top and bottom of each page
questions.correct: To add text at the top and bottom of each page
questions.feedback: The 'Header & Footer' feature allows you to add text, such as page numbers or titles, at the top and bottom of each page.

questions.question: Which tab in Microsoft Word allows you to change the document's theme?
questions.feedback: The 'Design' tab allows you to change the document's theme, including colors, fonts, and effects.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to redo an action in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + Y is the shortcut key to redo the last action in Microsoft Word.
